component.name: HTTPie
component.summary: Cross-platform API testing client for humans

description.p: HTTPie Desktop is a cross-platform API testing client for humans. It offers all the user-friendliness of the terminal version of httpie, now wrapped up in a sleek graphical interface.

ul.li: Interact painlessly with APIs
Leverage the power of AI-assisted work
Organize your work in spaces, collections, and tabs
Parametrize requests with variables and environments
Work across devices with auto-save and realtime sync
Build and preview requests without sending them
Use the app offline and without an account

description.p: 🪲 Fixed a bug introduced in 2024.1.1 that led to Control-W on Linux and Windows unintentionally closing the app window instead of just the current tab.

ul.li: 📙 New documentation site — quickly access it via the Help menu (httpie.io/docs/desktop)
♻️ New sync protocol — groundwork for upcoming multiplayer mode
🚜 Selective field merging — changes are now applied on the field level, not doc level
✌️ Conflict resolution — auto-merging of changes made across clients (same-field conflicts stay last-write-wins for now)
🚀 Much faster initial sync — up to 20 times fewer requests
💁‍♀️ Startup feedback — understand what the app is doing during longer operation
🛫 Ctrl+R to send request — don’t fight your muscle memory (desktop-only)
Fixed search and filter keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl+F and Shift+Ctrl+F) to always focus the input field
Fixed cursor jumping in search, replace, and filter fields when typing from start/middle
Fixed search from selection
Fixed missing params in cURL and HTTPie export
Fixed Bearer auth token sent as param instead of header under some circumstances
Fixed inheriting API key from collection and passing as param
Fixed handling of unnamed headers to be treated as disabled instead of invalid
Fixed validation of URLs containing variables
Fixed repeat invocations of the “Check again” button inside the “Update HTTPie” dialog
Fixed an infinite spinner on launch when the “No environment” option is selected in the environments selector.
Other stability improvements and minor bug fixes
